heading: Deaths
txt: Émile Faguet, French author and critic (b. 1847)

entities.title: Émile Faguet
entities.description: Auguste Émile Faguet was a French author and literary critic.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Pirrie, 1st Viscount Pirrie, Irish businessman and politician, Lord Mayor of Belfast (b. 1847)

entities.title: William Pirrie, 1st Viscount Pirrie
entities.description: William James Pirrie, 1st Viscount Pirrie, KP, PC, PC (Ire) was a leading British shipbuilder and businessman. He was chairman of Harland and Wolff, shipbuilders, between 1895 and 1924, and also served as Lord Mayor of Belfast between 1896 and 1898. He was ennobled as Baron Pirrie in 1906, appointed a Knight of the Order of St Patrick in 1908 and made Viscount Pirrie in 1921. In the months leading

entities.title: Lord Mayor of Belfast
entities.description: The Lord Mayor of Belfast is the leader and chairperson of Belfast City Council, elected annually from and by the City's 60 councillors.

heading: Deaths
txt: Archie Birkin, English motorcycle racer (b. 1905)

entities.title: Archie Birkin
entities.description: Archie Birkin was an English motorcycle racer, brother of Tim Birkin, one of the "Bentley Boys" of the 1920s.

heading: Deaths
txt: Edmund James Flynn, Canadian lawyer and politician, 10th Premier of Quebec (b. 1847)

entities.title: Premier of Quebec
entities.description: The Premier of Quebec is the head of government of the Canadian province of Quebec. The current Premier of Quebec is François Legault of the Coalition Avenir Québec, sworn in on October 18, 2018 following the 2018 election.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Verran, English-Australian politician, 26th Premier of South Australia (b. 1856)

entities.title: John Verran
entities.description: John Verran was the 26th Premier of South Australia from 1910 to 1912 and a senator for South Australia from August 1927 to November 1928, representing the South Australian United Labor Party. The 1910 state election saw Labor form a majority government, the first time a party had done so in South Australia. He was a resident of Moonta, and was member for the South Australian House of Assembly sea

entities.title: Premier of South Australia
entities.description: The Premier of South Australia is the head of government in the state of South Australia, Australia. The Government of South Australia follows the Westminster system, with a Parliament of South Australia acting as the legislature. heading: Deaths
txt: Jean Harlow, American actress and singer (b. 1911)

entities.title: Jean Harlow
entities.description: Jean Harlow was an American actress and sex symbol. Often nicknamed the "Blonde Bombshell" and the "Platinum Blonde", she was popular for her "Laughing Vamp" screen persona. Harlow was in the film industry for only nine years, but she became one of the biggest movie stars in Hollywood, whose image in the public eye has endured. In 1999, the American Film Institute ranked Harlow No. 22 on their gre

heading: Deaths
txt: Alan Blumlein, English engineer (b. 1903)

entities.title: Alan Blumlein
entities.description: Alan Dower Blumlein was an English electronics engineer, notable for his many inventions in telecommunications, sound recording, stereophonic sound, television and radar. He received 128 patents and was considered as one of the most significant engineers and inventors of his time.

heading: Deaths
txt: Kitaro Nishida, Japanese philosopher and academic (b. 1870)

entities.title: Kitaro Nishida
entities.description: Kitarō Nishida  was a prominent Japanese philosopher, founder of what has been called the Kyoto School of philosophy. He graduated from the University of Tokyo during the Meiji period in 1894 with a degree in philosophy. heading: Deaths
txt: Alan Turing, English mathematician and computer scientist (b. 1912)

entities.title: Alan Turing
entities.description: Alan Mathison Turing was an English mathematician, computer scientist, logician, cryptanalyst, philosopher, and theoretical biologist. Turing was highly influential in the development of theoretical computer science, providing a formalisation of the concepts of algorithm and computation with the Turing machine, which can be considered a model of a general-purpose computer. Turing is widely conside

heading: Deaths
txt: John Willcock, Australian politician, 15th Premier of Western Australia (b. 1879)

entities.title: John Willcock
entities.description: John Collings Willcock was the 15th Premier of Western Australia.

entities.title: Premier of Western Australia
entities.description: The Premier of Western Australia is the head of the executive branch of government in the Australian state of Western Australia. The Premier has similar functions in Western Australia to those performed by the Prime Minister of Australia at the national level, subject to the different Constitutions.

heading: Deaths
txt: Judy Holliday, American actress and singer (b. 1921)

entities.title: Judy Holliday
entities.description: Judy Holliday was an American actress, comedian and singer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Jean Arp, German-French sculptor, painter, and poet (b. 1886)

entities.title: Jean Arp
entities.description: Hans Peter Wilhelm Arp, better known as Jean Arp in English, was a German-French sculptor, painter, and poet. He was known as a Dadaist and an abstract artist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Anatoly Maltsev, Russian mathematician and academic (b. 1909)

entities.title: Anatoly Maltsev
entities.description: Anatoly Ivanovich Maltsev was born in Misheronsky, near Moscow, and died in Novosibirsk, USSR. He was a mathematician noted for his work on the decidability of various algebraic groups. Malcev algebras, as well as Malcev Lie algebras are named after him.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dorothy Parker, American poet, short story writer, critic, and satirist (b. 1893)

heading: Deaths
txt: Dan Duryea, American actor and singer (b. 1907)

entities.title: Dan Duryea
entities.description: Dan Duryea was an American actor in film, stage, and television. Known for portraying a vast range of character roles as a villain, he nonetheless had a long career in a wide variety of leading and secondary roles.

heading: Deaths
txt: E. M. Forster, English novelist, short story writer, essayist (b. 1879)

entities.title: E. M. Forster
entities.description: Edward Morgan Forster was an English fiction writer, essayist and librettist. Many of his novels examine class difference and hypocrisy, including A Room with a View (1908), Howards End (1910) and A Passage to India (1924). The last brought him his greatest success. He was nominated for the Nobel Prize in Literature in 16 separate years.

entities.description: Ronald George Wreyford Norrish FRS was a British chemist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1967.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry is awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences to scientists in the various fields of chemistry. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895, awarded for outstanding contributions in chemistry, physics, literature, peace, and physiology or medicine. entities.description: Elizabeth Josephine Craig, MBE, FRSA was a Scottish journalist, home economist and a notable author on cookery.

txt: Bill France Sr., American race car driver and businessman, co-founded NASCAR (b. 1909)

entities.title: Bill France Sr.
entities.description: William Henry Getty France, also known as Bill France Sr. or Big Bill, was an American businessman and racing driver. He is best known for founding and managing NASCAR, a sanctioning body of US-based stock car racing.

entities.title: NASCAR
entities.description: The National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing, LLC (NASCAR) is an American auto racing sanctioning and operating company that is best known for stock car racing. The privately owned company was founded by Bill France Sr. in 1948, and his son, Jim France, has been the CEO since August 6, 2018. The company is headquartered in Daytona Beach, Florida. heading: Deaths
txt: Hsuan Hua, Chinese monk and educator (b. 1918)

entities.title: Hsuan Hua
entities.description: Hsuan Hua, also known as An Tzu, Tu Lun and Master Hua by his Western disciples, was a Chinese monk of Chan Buddhism and a contributing figure in bringing Chinese Buddhism to the United States in the late 20th century.

heading: Deaths
txt: Víctor Paz Estenssoro, Bolivian politician, 52nd President of Bolivia (b. 1907)

entities.title: Víctor Paz Estenssoro
entities.description: Ángel Víctor Paz Estenssoro was a Bolivian politician who served as the 45th President of Bolivia for three nonconsecutive and four total terms from 1952 to 1956, 1960 to 1964 and 1985 to 1989. He ran for president eight times and was victorious in 1951, 1960, 1964 and 1985. entities.title: President of Bolivia
entities.description: The President of Bolivia, officially known as the President of the Plurinational State of Bolivia, is head of state and head of government of Bolivia and the Captain General of the Armed Forces of Bolivia.

heading: Deaths
txt: Signe Hasso, Swedish-American actress (b. 1915)

entities.title: Signe Hasso
entities.description: Signe Eleonora Cecilia Hasso was a Swedish actress, writer, and composer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Phillip V. Tobias, South African paleontologist and academic (b. 1925)

entities.title: Phillip V. Tobias
entities.description: Phillip Vallentine Tobias was a South African palaeoanthropologist and Professor Emeritus at the University of the Witwatersrand in Johannesburg. He was best known for his work at South Africa's hominid fossil sites. He was also an activist for the eradication of apartheid and gave numerous anti-apartheid speeches at protest rallies and also to academic audiences.

heading: Deaths
txt: Pierre Mauroy, French educator and politician, Prime Minister of France (b. 1928)

entities.title: Pierre Mauroy
entities.description: Pierre Mauroy was a French Socialist politician who was Prime Minister of France from 1981 to 1984 under President François Mitterrand. Mauroy also served as Mayor of Lille from 1973 to 2001. At the time of his death Mauroy was the emeritus mayor of the city of Lille. heading: Deaths
txt: Christopher Lee, English actor (b. 1922)

entities.title: Christopher Lee
entities.description: Sir Christopher Frank Carandini Lee, was an English actor, singer and author. With a career spanning nearly seven decades, Lee was well known for portraying villains, gaining recognition for appearing as Count Dracula in a sequence of Hammer Horror films.
